SENT.plain: An 18-year-old woman with extensive cerebral venous thrombosis is described
The symptoms were fever, headache, nausea, vomiting and focal deficits
The diagnosis was confirmed by CT and MRI
Full restitution was achieved within three months
Possible predisposing factors were use of oral contraceptive, smoking and anticardiolipin antibodies
The causes, symptoms, investigations and possible modes of therapy are discussed
